May Senator Carl Levin‚Äôs memory be a blessing and may his legacy live forever on in the hearts of Michiganders, and those who he inspired.
Rob and I are sending all of our love and prayers to the entire Levin family, especially his wife Barbara, children, brother Sandy, and my wonderful colleague Andy Levin.
His confidence in me is something that I cherish and will always carry with me.

There is no one like Senator Carl Levin, and there will never be another like him. He was a hero to me, and so many people he worked with and inspired. I will never forget November 1, 2018, when he told a room full of people "Haley can do this."

Senator Levin was not one to play political games, but one to always stand up for what was right. Former Senator McCain said it best: "We all listen to him, and we listen closest to him on the occasions when we disagree with him."

What really stands out when thinking about Senator Levin‚Äôs legacy was the respect that he garnered across both sides of the aisle; he showed how progress can still be possible when we stick to our convictions but also insist on coming together as Americans.

I experienced this firsthand while serving as the Chief of Staff to the U.S. Auto Rescue Task Force; Senator Levin was one of the toughest on us, because he knew what the auto industry meant to the countless Michigan workers who relied on its success.

Senator Carl Levin was a giant among Michiganders, and among Congress as a whole. His 36-year tenure in the U.S. Senate was filled with not only great accomplishments, but steadfast dedication to Michigan.
